meanings.definition: Not involving or relating to machinery or mechanical devices.
meanings.sent1: The artist's nonmechanical approach to painting focused on using only natural materials.
meanings.sent2: The old windmill was a nonmechanical structure, relying solely on the power of the wind.
meanings.sent3: The nonmechanical clock made of flowers bloomed at different times of the day.
meanings.sent4: Her nonmechanical mind worked like a garden, growing ideas organically.
meanings.sent5: The nonmechanical dance of the leaves in the breeze was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: Not operated or controlled by a machine or mechanical process.
meanings.sent1: The traditional loom was a nonmechanical device, requiring manual weaving.
meanings.sent2: The nonmechanical water pump relied on human power to draw water from the well.
meanings.sent3: The nonmechanical toy car was powered by imagination, not batteries.
meanings.sent4: Her nonmechanical approach to problem-solving involved creativity over technology.
meanings.sent5: The nonmechanical clock was set by the position of the sun in the sky.
